data_table.description: Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview, Visit 5. Participants with or without atherosclerosis and cardiovascular disease and involved in the "Atherosclerosis Risk in Communities (ARIC) Cohort" project.

variable.name: SUBJECT_ID
variable.description: ARIC subject ID [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI1
variable.description: Background. Q1. Relationship to subject [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI2
variable.description: Background. Q2. For how many years have you known subject [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI3
variable.description: Memory. Q3. How often do you see subject? [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]
variable.value: Every day or every other day
Between one and three times a week
A few times a year or less often

variable.name: CDI4
variable.description: Memory. Q14. Subject has hearing difficulties [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI5
variable.description: Memory. Q15. Subject has visual difficulties [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI6
variable.description: Memory. Q16. Subject has walking or balance difficulties [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI7
variable.description: Background. Q7. Subject first language is English [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI8
variable.description: Background. Q8. Subject has circumstances that impact daily functioning [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI8A
variable.description: Background. Q8a. Subject circumstances that impact daily functioning [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI9
variable.description: Background. Q9. Were any of subject's immediate family members, that is biological parents or full brothers or sisters, ever diagnosed with dementia, Alzheimer disease, senility, or hardening of the arteries in the brain? [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI9A
variable.description: Background. Q9a. Mother had dementia, Alzheimer disease, or senility [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI9B
variable.description: Background. Q9b. Father had dementia, Alzheimer disease, or senility [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI9C
variable.description: Background. Q9c. Sibling had dementia, Alzheimer disease, or senility [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI10
variable.description: Memory. Q10. Subject has been diagnosed with dementia, Alzheimer Disease or mild cognitive impairment? Mci [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI11
variable.description: Memory. Q11. Subject consistent changes In memory over the past year [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI11A
variable.description: Memory. Q11a. Did the memory changes start slowly, or more quickly? [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI12
variable.description: Memory. Q12. Subject consistently complain about memory problems? [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI13
variable.description: Memory. Q13. Subject forgets recent events [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI14
variable.description: Memory. Q14. Subject repeats same questions or stories [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI15
variable.description: Memory. Q15. Subject forgets conversations [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI16
variable.description: Memory. Q16. Subjects spends more time looking for belongings [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI17
variable.description: Memory. Q17. Subject forgets appointments [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI18
variable.description: Memory. Q18. Subject has trouble keeping track of current events [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI19
variable.description: Memory. Q19. Subject forgets names of friends/relatives [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI20
variable.description: Memory. Q20. Subject forgets mid-stream [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI21
variable.description: Orientation. Q21. Subject has trouble knowing day of week and date [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI22
variable.description: Orientation. Q22. Subject has trouble with directions in familiar areas [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI23
variable.description: Judgement and Problem Solving. Q23. Subject has changes in thinking and judgment [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI24
variable.description: Judgement and Problem Solving. Q24. Subject handling unexpected problems [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI25
variable.description: Judgement and Problem Solving. Q25. Subject ability to handle money [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI26
variable.description: Judgement and Problem Solving. Q26. Subject ability to handle more complicated financial transactions [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI27
variable.description: Judgement and Problem Solving. Q27. Subject has less desire to do necessary chores [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI28
variable.description: Judgement and Problem Solving. Q28. Subject has other changes in thinking and judgment [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI29
variable.description: Judgement and Problem Solving. Q29. Subject has difficulty at job due to memory or thinking [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]
variable.value: Retired, and not working at volunteer jobs

variable.name: CDI30
variable.description: Community Affairs. Q30. Subject less involved in activities outside the home than previously [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI31
variable.description: Community Affairs. Q31. Subject has difficulty shopping or purchasing alone [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI32
variable.description: Community Affairs. Q32. Subject exhibits unsafe motor vehicle practices [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI33
variable.description: Home and Hobbies. Q33. Subject ability to do household chores [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI34
variable.description: Home and Hobbies. Q34. Subject has trouble using household appliances [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI35
variable.description: Home and Hobbies. Q35. Subject has decreased interest in hobbies [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI36
variable.description: Home and Hobbies. Q36. Subject has trouble using stove [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI37
variable.description: Home and Hobbies. Q37. Subject has trouble preparing a balanced meal [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI38
variable.description: Personal Care. Q38. Subject has difficulty with personal hygiene [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI39
variable.description: Personal Care. Q39. Subject has difficulty with bladder/bowel control [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI40
variable.description: Personal Care. Q40. Subject has incontinence or accidents with bladder or bowels? [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI41
variable.description: Behavior, Comportment and Personality. Q41. Subject has personality change [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI42
variable.description: Behavior, Comportment and Personality. Q42. Subject has a loss of insight into problems [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI43
variable.description: Behavior, Comportment and Personality. Q43. Subject is disinhibited/socially inappropriate [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI44
variable.description: Behavior, Comportment and Personality. Q44. Subject is impulsive [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI45
variable.description: Behavior, Comportment and Personality. Q45. Does subject understand effect of behavior on others? [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI46
variable.description: Behavior, Comportment and Personality. Q46. Subject is socially withdrawn [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI47
variable.description: Behavior, Comportment and Personality. Q47. Subject shows widely swinging emotions [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI48
variable.description: Behavior, Comportment and Personality. Q48. Subject is restless [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI49
variable.description: Behavior, Comportment and Personality. Q49. Subject is distractible [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI50
variable.description: Behavior, Comportment and Personality. Q50. Subjects has changed food preferences [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI51
variable.description: Behavior, Comportment and Personality. Q51. Subject shows repeated physical movements [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI52
variable.description: Behavior, Comportment and Personality. Q52. Subject has no interest in previously enjoyed activities [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI53
variable.description: Behavior, Comportment and Personality. Q53. Subject is uninterested in personal appearance [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI54
variable.description: Language. Q54. Subject has alterations in speech and language [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI55
variable.description: Language. Q55. Subject has difficulty speaking [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI56
variable.description: Language. Q56. Subject has difficulty understanding ordinary conversations [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI57
variable.description: Language. Q57. Subject has difficulty finding words or names [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI58
variable.description: For Interviewer. Q58. Interviewer rate of informant knowledge of subject [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI59
variable.description: For Interviewer. Q59. Interviewer rate of informant reliability [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI59A
variable.description: For Interviewer. Q59a. Interviewer aware of extenuating circumstances that interfered with quality of informant responses [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI60
variable.description: For Interviewer. Q60. Interviewer opinion of subject daily level of function [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI61
variable.description: For Interviewer. Q61. Was this interview conducted in person or over the phone? [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI62
variable.description: For Interviewer. Q62. Was written or oral consent obtained from the informant for this questionnaire? [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]

variable.name: CDI0AY
variable.description: Year of completion date [Clinical Dementia Rating Informant Interview]
